security: Dissemination of information about NY 694-S*, a valuable informant, could potentially identify the informant and compromise their safety.
summary: This document primarily focuses on providing information to the U.S. Senate Select Committee (SSC) concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and Stanley Levison's alleged ties to the Communist Party USA (CPUSA). It details FBI efforts to furnish materials establishing factual basis for Levison's secret CPUSA membership.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated November 20, 1975, addresses the U.S. Senate Select Committee's (SSC) requests, led by Senator Frank Church, for materials concerning Martin Luther King, Jr., and Stanley Levison's alleged ties to the Communist Party USA (CPUSA). The FBI provides information including original recordings from Bureau informants, specifically detailing efforts to establish Levison's secret CPUSA membership, while also addressing challenges in locating specific communications requested by the SSC. The memo references a prior oral briefing given to Senator Church and SSC staff and includes related correspondence and documents.
title: U. S. SENATE SELECT COMMITTEE ON INTELLIGENCE ACTIVITIES (SSC)
recipient: U. S. SENATE SELECT COMMITTEE ON INTELLIGENCE ACTIVITIES (SSC)
